info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 4:31PM CDT until May 20 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and north central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Livingston. In north central Illinois, La Salle.
* WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Streator, Marseilles, Oglesby, Seneca, South Streator, Tonica, Grand Ridge, Cornell, Lostant, Ransom, Rutland, Cedar Point, Kangley, Long Point, Dana and Leonore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING
